release_notes.en-US: - New feature to upload OGP image of the page is added.

description.en-US:
Gyazo is the easiest way to capture, share, and bookmark. With Gyazo for Firefox you can capture anything you see on the web including whole pages. Everything is saved to your Gyazo account so you can easily access from any device. When capturing, sharing, and viewing is this easy it's more fun. What can it do? Right click to capture a specific image or click the icon to capture a page element, screenshot, or entire web page. It uploads and copies the link to your clipboard automatically. You can also preview Gyazo links other people share simply by hovering with your mouse. How to use Gyazo for Firefox Capturing with right click
  • Right click any image on the web then click 'Capture this image.’ It'll upload the image at full size and show a preview to confirm the link has been copied to your clipboard. Unlike the Gyazo app it won’t open a new tab.
Capturing with the toolbar icon
  • Page Element Captures by element of the page such as an image, a text box, or a large block.
  • Free Selection Captures any area of the page freely, similar to the Gyazo desktop app.
  • Page Captures only the visible area of the current webpage.
  • Whole page Captures the entire webpage from the top to the very bottom.
  • Home This is a link that opens your homepage in a tab so you can search, browse, and collect your captures. *Free user access is limited to 10 captures.
Previewing Gyazo Links
  • When you hover over a Gyazo link on any web page you can see an instant preview right there, no click required.
How to Use Gyazo (The Basics) Images you capture will automatically be uploaded to gyazo.com with a unique link that is copied to your clipboard. The link is unlisted and won’t be visible to anyone else until it is shared. Create an account to see and manage all your images
  • On the home page you can browse, search, and sort everything you capture. Images are saved with certain info such as the original address and title of the source webpage to enable sorting and search. See where your favorite images came from, search by source, and then click a link to visit the origin again. This is a lightning-fast way to create visual bookmarks.
Create collections to group images and collaborate with other people
  • Once you have a set of images you like you can also add them to a collection and give it a title. This is a handy way to organize your collection and share a set of specific images at once. You can invite other people to add to a collection too.
Get Gyazo wherever you go You can also get the free Gyazo extensions for Chrome, Edge, and the free Gyazo apps for Windows, Mac, iOS, and Android. :)
description.ja: Title: Collect + share anything instantly.' Body text: Now you can capture, share, and view images faster than ever. Everything is saved to your Gyazo account so you can easily access your collection from anywhere. Grab a specific image, page element, screenshot, or entire web page in two clicks. You can also get instant previews of all Gyazo links posted online. When it’s this fast you can have fun saving, collecting, and sharing what you want. Key features — Capture any image directly with right click Right click any image you see on the web then click 'capture this image.’ It'll upload the image full size and show a preview to confirm the link has been copied to your clipboard. Unlike the Gyazo app it won’t open a new tab. — Capture from the Gyazo icon in the toolbar - Page Element Select individual elements of the page such as an image, a text box, or a larger section of a webpage without having to carefully crop it. - Free Selection This lets you select any area of the webpage you want, similar to our desktop app. - Page This captures only the visible area of the current webpage. - Whole page This will capture the entire webpage, all the way from top to the very bottom. - Home This is simply a link that will open your homepage in a new tab so you can browse, organize, and edit your collection. ---Previewing When you hover over a Gyazo link on any web page you can see an instant preview right there, no click required. ---How it works: The basics Images you capture will automatically be uploaded to Gyazo.com with a unique URL. This link is copied to your clipboard so it is ready to be pasted & shared immediately. The URL is unlisted and won’t be visible to anyone else until it is shared or privacy settings are changed. ---Create an account to see and manage all your images On the home page you can browse, search, and sort everything you capture. Images are saved with certain info such as the original address and title of the source webpage to enable sorting and search. With this feature you can see just where your favorite images came from, search by source, and then click a link to visit the origin again. This is very useful for creating visual bookmarks. ---Create collections to group images and work with others Once you have a set of images you like you can also add them to a collection and give it a title. This is a handy way to organize your collection and share a set of specific images at once. You can even invite others to add to your collection too. All this and more is fast and fun with the new Gyazo extension. Get it now for Chrome, Firefox, Windows, Mac, and iOS.

summary.en-US: The easiest way to capture, share, and bookmark from the web.
summary.ja: Grab any image on the web and share it instantly.
